content: ऐंद्र {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (द्री|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [इंद्र-अण्] Belonging or sacred to Indra; <ls>R. 2. 50</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 27.</ls> --द्रः {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of Arjuna and of Vāli (who are regarded as sons of इंद्र). {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a Saṃvatsara. {@--3@} The part of a sacrifice offered to Indra. --द्री {@--1@} <ab>N.</ab> of a {%Ṛk%} addressed to Indra; इत्यादिका काचिदैंद्री समाम्नाता <ls>J. N. V.</ls> {@--2@} The east, eastern direction (presided over by Indra); अयमैंद्रीमुखं पश्य रक्तश्चुंबति चंद्रमाः <ls>Chandr. 5. 58</ls>; <ls>Ki. 9. 18.</ls> {@--3@} The eighteenth lunar mansion. {@--4@} The eighth day in the second half of the months of मार्गशीर्ष and पौष. {@--5@} Indra's energy (personified as his wife Śacī). {@--6@} Misfortune, misery. {@--7@} A kind of cucumber. {@--8@} An epithet of Durgā. {@--9@} Small cardamom. --द्रं {@--1@} The eighteenth lunar mansion (ज्येष्ठा). {@--2@} Wild ginger.
